headline.main: W.H.O. Plan On Tobacco: Limit Ads, Raise Taxes

docs.abstract: Delegates from 191 countries belonging to World Health Orgn gather in Geneva to work on final text of treaty to control tobacco and its devastating effects on public health; one in three people over age 15 in Switzerland smokes; despite Switzerland's high cost of living, cigarettes are cheaper there than in any other Western European country, and number of cancer deaths is rising; WHO director general, Gro Harlem Brundtland, comments on treaty, result of four years of intense negotiations; provisions include limits on advertising, and imposing higher taxes (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: It is nearly impossible to find a no-smoking table in a restaurant in Switzerland, a country where one in three people over age 15 lights up. Despite Switzerland's high cost of living, cigarettes are cheaper here than in any other Western European country, and the number of cancer deaths is rising.
